channel.title: Inciting Happiness: Lama Marut’s Unabridged Teachings
channel.description: Get medieval on your mental afflictions and stop playing footsies with a life of suffering and frustration. If we are ever to achieve our true purpose in life – true and deep-seated happiness -- we will need to end our inertia and passivity, stand up and fight the Powers That Be, and get armed and dangerous with radical compassion and unshakeable wisdom.

image.title: Inciting Happiness: Lama Marut’s Unabridged Teachings
image.description: Inciting Happiness: Lama Marut’s Unabridged Teachings

channel.itunes:author: Lama Sumati Marut
channel.itunes:keywords: Lama Sumati Marut, Asian Classics Institute, Diamond Mountain, Dharma, Tibetan Buddhism, Meditation, ACI-LA, ACI-Cape Ann
channel.itunes:subtitle: Get medieval on your mental afflictions and stop playing footsies with a life of suffering and frustration.
channel.itunes:summary:
Get medieval on your mental afflictions and stop playing footsies with a life of suffering and frustration. If we are ever to achieve our true purpose in life – true and deep-seated happiness -- we will need to end our inertia and passivity, stand up and fight the Powers That Be, and get armed and dangerous with radical compassion and unshakeable wisdom.

item.title: Epic Fail - Part 2
item.description:
“Epic Fail: Disappointment as a Path to Happiness.” Anyone who has actually tried to improve themselves spiritually knows what failure looks and feels like. In fact, the only way not to fail is not try at all.

Download the reading for this teaching here: http://aci-la.org/ALLAUDIO/Epic_Fail/EPIC%20FAIL.pdf

item.title: From Surprising to Miraculous: Rediscovering the Miracles of Everyday Life
item.description:

This teaching was given in Munich in May of 2010

item.description:
We have gotten all the things we thought would bring us happiness and yet we are still not satisfied. Lama Marut tells us how to find the real causes for happiness.


Download the reading for this teaching here: http://aci-la.org/ALLAUDIO/ComponentsSpiritualPractice/Components%20of%20Daily%20Practice.doc

This teaching was given in Munich, 4/20/09.

item.title: The Spiritual Teachings of Jesus and the Buddha
item.description:
The great religions are not singular entities, they are genealogies that depend on teachers. Lama Marut looks at the spiritual teachings of Jesus and the Buddha and asks "What can we learn from these two teachers?"


Download the reading for this teaching here: http://www.aci-la.org/ALLAUDIO/Christian/Jesus_and_Buddha_LA.pdf

This teaching was given in Satyananda Asram, Roclyn, Victoria, AU

item.title: Changing the Past by Letting Go of Resentment
item.description:
Lama Marut explores chapter Six of Master Shanti Deva's Guide to the Bodhisttva's Way of Life and all the reasons why we should avoid getting angry. Holding on to bitterness, resentment, and anger about what happened to us in the past keeps us from being happy in the present. Since our understanding of the past is constantly changing, if we can learn to take control of the process that we already do, we can gift ourselves with a better past.

This teaching was given in Melbourne Australia January 2009.

Write to us at: podcast@aci-la.org

To subscribe to Lama Marut’s excerpted audio podcasts please visit: http://www.aci-la.org/lama_marut_podcast.html

item.title: The Four Immeasurables and the Development of a Good Heart—Part 4
item.description:
In Part 4 of this four-part teaching, Lama Marut outlines the key parts of a daily practice. Then, working with Verses 7 and 8 of “Eight Verses to Develop a Good Heart” by Dorje Senge (Diamond Lion), Lama Marut focuses on immeasurable joy, which is the wish and decision to see to it that all beings attain ultimate happiness.

This teaching was given in Rockport MA in March 2008.

To download the text referred to in this teaching: http://www.aci-la.org/ALLAUDIO/4Immeasurables/FOUR_IMMEASURABLES.pdf

item.title: The Four Immeasurables and the Development of a Good Heart—Part 3
item.description:
In Part 3 of this four-part teaching, Lama Marut first looks at the two wings on which one can fly to happiness: compassion and wisdom. Then, working with Verses 5 and 6 of “Eight Verses to Develop a Good Heart” by Dorje Senge (Diamond Lion), Lama Marut focuses on immeasurable loving-kindness, which is the wish and decision to see that all beings achieve happiness.

This teaching was given in Rockport MA in March 2008.

To download the text referred to in this teaching: http://www.aci-la.org/ALLAUDIO/4Immeasurables/FOUR_IMMEASURABLES.pdf

item.title: The Four Immeasurables and the Development of a Good Heart—Part 2
item.description:
In Part 2 of this four-part teaching, Lama Marut first looks at the relevance of the Buddha’s story of becoming enlightened in showing us how to use the four immeasureables to become happy. Then, using “Eight Verses to Develop a Good Heart” by Dorje Senge (Diamond Lion), Lama Marut concludes the explanation of immeasurable equanimity and discusses immeasurable compassion.

This teaching was given in Rockport MA in March 2008.

item.description:

item.title: The Three Principal Paths - Part 2
item.description:
In the conclusion of this two-class teaching, Lama Marut focuses on the second principal path, bodhicitta or the mind that searches for enlightenment to help all beings, and includes a discussion of two methods for reaching bodhicitta. He wraps up with the third principal path, wisdom.

This teaching was given in Singapore on January 20, 2009.

To download the text referred to in this teaching: http://aci-la.org/documents/Singapore%20PDFs/3%20principal%20paths.pdf

If you are interested in listening to the detailed, two-class teaching about the third Principal Path, Wisdom, that Lama Marut refers to in this teaching, please go to: http://www.aci-la.org/teach_marut_empty.html - Look for "Arya Nagarjuna, Singapore"

item.title: The Three Principal Paths - Part 1
item.description:
Lama Marut begins by laying out an overview of the Three Principal Paths of Buddhism and then, in this first of two classes, he works with a beautiful and important foundational Tibetan Buddhist text to focus on the first path, renunciation from suffering.

This teaching was given in Singapore on January 20, 2009.

To download the text referred to in this teaching: http://aci-la.org/documents/Singapore%20PDFs/3%20principal%20paths.pdf

Write to us at: podcast@aci-la.org

To subscribe to Lama Marut’s excerpted audio podcasts please visit: http://www.aci-la.org/lama_marut_podcast.html

To subscribe to Lama Marut’s video podcasts please visit: http://www.aci-la.org/mg-video.html

For additional, complete audio teachings please visit: http://www.aci-la.org/teach_marut.html and http://www.lamamarut.org

item.title: A Pathway to a Happier Life: Gratitude
item.description:
In this sweet teaching, Lama Marut uses published research to illustrate the amazing benefits we get from cultivating gratitude. He offers several very simple strategies to develop this important quality, which leads us to live happier lives. This teaching includes a powerful guided meditation to help listeners get started.

Write to us at: podcast@aci-la.org

To subscribe to Lama Marut’s excerpted audio podcasts please visit: http://www.aci-la.org/lama_marut_podcast.html

item.title: Cultivating True Happiness
item.description:
In this soup-to-nuts happiness feast, Lama Marut looks at why we're not happy and addresses simple and more complex ways to cultivate happiness. He completes this in-depth exploration with an analysis of an important Tibetan Buddhist text, Eight Verses for Developing the Good Heart, by 11thcentury author Dorje Senge (The Diamond Lion).

This podcast is from a teaching given in Reno, Nevada, in April of 2007

Write to us at: podcast@aci-la.org

For more information and audio teachings, please visit: http://www.aci-la.org/teach_marut.html or http://www.lamamarut.org/

To subscribe to Lama Marut’s video podcasts please visit: http://www.aci-la.org/mg-video.html
